StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Dec
StringTable.String: Inventors of the hyperdrive, and one of the youngest races on the galactic stage, Terrans are known for both their professed love of diplomacy, and their proficient use of violence when that diplomacy fails.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Still haunted by the fact he had to order a retreat and sacrifice undefended civilians.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
Despite being the youngest race in the galaxy, the Terrans are perhaps the most dangerous. Inventors of the hyperdrive, it was their decision to spread it to their neighbors which led to the current arms race the galaxy finds itself in.
Although Terrans present themselves as a peaceful and diplomatic people, their reputation is far more mixed. They possess a flair for violence, and a willingness to exercise it. Although Terrans find nothing strange about this dichotomy, many of their galactic peers regard it as alarming, and even duplicitous.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Terrans are naturally adventurous, with fast, long ranging ships. Their production capacity and diplomatic abilities are well regarded. Their ability to field large fleets is regarded with a bit more wariness.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_FESTRON_Dec
StringTable.String: Of the dozens of sentient species that evolved on the Festron homeworld, only the Festron remain. This was not an accident; the Festron view other species as little more than hosts for their eggs.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_FESTRON_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Hatched from the corpse of a Drath elder.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_FESTRON_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: While other species search for idyllic worlds to grow and thrive, the Festron prefer worlds that are already occupied. They see other sentient species as prey to be hunted and hosts for their larva. The Festron take an extraordinarily long view to this activity, and have been known to drop lone individuals onto worlds to spend generations lurking and hunting the local population. Some are rumored to have even reached as far as Earth. Bottom line: there is no sharing worlds with the Festron.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_FESTRON_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Festron are a strong and aggressive species, tolerant of war and quick to brave the dangers of space. But it will be difficult to take advantage of the citizens of multiple species as the Festron will kill and replace them.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_NAVIGATORS_Dec
StringTable.String: A mysterious spacefaring race, the Navigators true homeworld has long been lost to history. Until recently, they viewed worlds as little more than meager platforms from which to build ships. But now something has changed...

StringTable.Label: FACTION_NAVIGATORS_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Has a collection of disassembled precursor artifacts.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_NAVIGATORS_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
A starfaring race, the Navigators have traveled from star to star investigating the mysteries of the Precursors for so long that the history of their own homeworld has drifted into conflicting legends. For mysterious reasons, their journey has recently stopped.
Only among the most senior of the Navigators is it now acknowledged that the rapid advancement of other species will inevitably lead to the extinction of the Navigators, that is if they don't abandon their nomadic lifestyle and become a true galactic civilization.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_NAVIGATORS_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Navigator's starfaring history has left them in a barren and infertile star system. But they control several colony ships and part of their population is still on them. If they can make it safely to new worlds they should receive a jump start on other species.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MIMOT_Dec
StringTable.String:
The Mimots evolved on a planet with five other species. Today they are the only sentient species on their world.
Their high rate of reproduction is a mixed blessing as they face a balancing act between their people's rapid population growth and the never ending struggle of finding enough food for everyone.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MIMOT_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Actually one in a long line of Walla the Seconds.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MIMOT_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
The Mimot have evolved to the point that they no longer resemble their original bodyforms in the slightest.
Having expanded into the galaxy and served as servants, cooks, and when the larder was low, the meal itself, the Mimot have until recently been mostly known for their diligent work ethic and nutty flavor.
Having evolved on a world with five other sentient species, no one is quite sure how it came to be that the Mimot were the only ones to survive.
Only recently have the Mimot come to possess the technological capability to begin building their own galactic civilization.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MIMOT_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Mimot reproduce at an incredible rate. Where most species struggle to find new citizens to populate the worlds they discover the Mimot struggle to find worlds to house their ever growing citizens.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_XELOXI_Dec
StringTable.String: The Xeloxi are almost perfectly self-interested, with no system of morality beyond the simple truth that an individual should seek their own maximum benefit. They find other civilization's systems of laws hilariously quaint and misguided.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_XELOXI_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Pretends to come from Xeloxi elite, but was actually raised in the dark back alleys of Refuge.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_XELOXI_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: A civilization founded entirely on the principles of self-interest leads to a curious side-effect, at least from the eyes of an outsider: every Xeloxi citizen is a criminal. The Xeloxi government, no less criminal itself, maintains control over this unruly mob through brutal and often random displays of power. Surprisingly, this seemingly unworkable system, which other civilizations might see as the darkest chapters of their history, is not only stable for the Xeloxi, but actually allows them to thrive.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_XELOXI_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Be prepared to deal with high crime. But with the Xeloxi, the answer isn't always to try to reduce it. Higher crime unlocks special improvements on their worlds, and with the right policies they can spread crime to other civilization's worlds as well.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ARCEAN_Dec
StringTable.String: The Arcean Empire are famous for their commitment to neutrality, a trait that was almost fatal to them. Liberated by the Terran Alliance, they now strive to rebuild their Empire, vowing to never be subjugated again.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ARCEAN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Spent the last decade leading an underground resistance force.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ARCEAN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: One of the oldest races in the galaxy, it was the Arceans who provided the genesis of the idea for the hyperdrive to the Terrans, a gesture which led to the arms race which nearly pushed them to the brink of destruction. Freed from the yoke of the Drengin - with the help of that same Terran Alliance - the Arceans have finally regained their homeworld, and with it the chance to rebuild their once mighty Empire. In the years of the Drengin occupation, the Arcean Resistance never stopped fighting. Their leader, Lord Verga, became a legend, whose name struck fear into even the most brutal Drengin soldiers.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ARCEAN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String:
The Arcean Empire was not left with many assets, just their home world and a few precious resources they liberated from the Drengin. They have come back from the brink, tougher, and more resilient than ever.
The Arcean people have a long history of nobility and neutrality, but the occupation has left them much less willing to forgive offenses or tolerate threats to their freedom.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRENGIN_Dec
StringTable.String: The Drengin are a profoundly evil and warlike civilization. Exceedingly clever and vicious, there are few beings capable of meeting a Drengin and not becoming its next meal.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRENGIN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Having crushed all local threats he searches the galaxy for another frontier to conquer.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRENGIN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Drengin are one of the older races in the galaxy, with an internal history rich with tales of conquest and bloodshed, dominating the lesser species of first their planet, then others. Many of their victims have discovered that the Drengin are not mindlessly stupid, but indeed rather inventive in their application of cruelty. There are few ways to devour a slaveling that the Drengin haven't thought up. Though simple beatings are usually the most economically prudent option for slaveling discipline.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRENGIN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Drengin soldiers are savagely effective at ground-based combat, and their naval vessels are famously tough. Their military manufacturing ability is also impressive, but Drengin colonies do sometimes struggle with discontent. Much of their famous inventiveness is put into stopping slaveling revolts.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ALTARIAN_Dec
StringTable.String: Altarians are a deeply religious race, taken to acts of great benevolence in their interaction with others. This has, perhaps not coincidentally, given them a reputation for being self-righteous.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ALTARIAN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Daughter of a high priestess and born during an eclipse.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ALTARIAN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Altarians are a deeply religious race, claiming to have at one point been touched by powerful beings known as the Precursors. Kind and generous to a fault, their unique history means Altarians are prone to a certain degree of self righteousness when they find themselves dealing with other, lesser races. For some as yet unexplained reason, Altarians appear almost identical in appearance to Terrans, and make easy friends with Earthlings when they come across them. Altarian prophecy has spoken of the day they would one day meet their cousins. Few know if that prophecy had anything to say about what would happen next.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ALTARIAN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Altarians are careful researchers, generally content, and influential with their neighbors. Their ships are known for being fast but fragile, though they can organize large fleets of them when called upon.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_YOR_Dec
StringTable.String: An ancient race of sentient artificial beings, the Yor have no need for crude biological methods for reproduction and consumption, and can inhabit worlds other races would find intolerable.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_YOR_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: One of the few first-generation Yor that remain.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_YOR_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Yor are artificial beings, originally servants of an ancient species known as the Iconians. Granted sentience by the Dread Lords, the Yor turned against their Iconian creators, apparently wiping them from the face of the galaxy. Whether due to some hidden command of the Dread Lord, or simply from applying the cold rules of logic, the Yor have since become viciously xenophobic, and now despise all biological life forms. Capable of long-term planning and a surprising degree of cunning, the Yor often speak with and negotiate with organic beings. Those beings should understand that this is nothing but a short term ploy, and that their new friends will never rest until they, and all other organic life is destroyed.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_YOR_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Yor are highly productive and capable of building large fleets of self-repairing vessels. They're profoundly unpopular, and few races opt to befriend them. Unlike organic races, their growth rate is a function of production capacity.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TORIAN_Dec
StringTable.String: Twice made slaves of the Drengin Empire, the Torians now strive to rebuild their once great civilization. Possessing a keen survivor's instinct, Torians are willing to work with even the most undesirable forces if it means securing their future.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TORIAN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Called the Unbreakable because he resisted Drengin imprisonment and torture.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TORIAN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: Survivors in the face of incredible odds, the Torian Regime has twice been enslaved by the Drengin Empire. Thought to be utterly defeated by the rest of the galaxy, the Torians took advantage of the Terran Crusade against the Drengin to once again liberate themselves. With the help of hired mercenaries, they now struggle to rebuild their Regime and secure their place in the galaxy, having vowed to never be slaves again.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TORIAN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String:
The Torian Regime has lost much, but their spirit remains unbroken. They have also gained the favor of powerful mercenary forces and have learned to use them to great advantage.
As a race that first evolved to sentience in the oceans of their home world, they also have the advantage of being able to colonize Oceanic worlds and are hospitable to most races.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MANTI_Dec
StringTable.String: A generation of their spawn was stolen by otherworldly raiders. The Manti's rapid response - the leap on to the galactic stage in search of their lost generation - has raised eyebrows. The Manti remain unapologetic.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MANTI_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Babble allowed raiders to land on the planet. He is trying to make up for that mistake.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MANTI_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The first united technical achievement of the Manti was the creation of a great beacon tower, designed to announce their presence to the unknown. A few days after turning it on an answer was received, a fleet of warships appearing in orbit, raiders arriving en masse to collect every child on the planet. An entire generation, lost. Humiliated at their unsophisticated thinking, the surviving Manti, and the generations that followed, began exploring space on their own, both fearful that the raiders would return, and eager to some day confront them, and find the children that were stolen from them.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_MANTI_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The tragedy of their lost generation results in less starting citizens than other species, but it has united them. The Unwavering trait makes them less susceptible to culture flips from other species.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_KRYNN_Dec
StringTable.String: The Krynn are somewhat unique in the galaxy, a civilization composed of a variety of species united by a shared religion. The variety of citizens is a great asset of the Krynn, who can make use of the strengths of each.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_KRYNN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Though religious now, his power was gained through less noble means.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_KRYNN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Krynn are not a single race, but a coalition of sentient beings united by a shared religion. The central tenet of their religion is the knowledge that salvation will not be achieved until all sentient life in the galaxy follows the Way of the Krynn. As the rest of the galaxy knows by now, the Krynn waste few available opportunities to convert unbelievers when they find them. In recent years, a secretive criminal organization has seized the reigns of power in Krynn civilization. Known as the Syndicate, they pursue the Way of the Krynn via some decidedly more sinister paths than the peaceful language of their religion might suggest.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_KRYNN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Krynn are well suited for expansion, being rapid breeders with fast, far-ranging ships. Their outspoken nature make them unpopular though, and their limited military manufacturing means they have to consider their most aggressive conversion activities very carefully.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ICONIAN_Dec
StringTable.String: Servants of the Precursors and one of the first races to reach the stars, the Iconians are now locked in a bitter struggle with their own creations; the Yor.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ICONIAN_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Rarely seen outside his secure chamber.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ICONIAN_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Iconians are the oldest of the so called young races, once servants to the Precursors themselves. Creators of the Yor, they were almost wiped out when their creations were given sentience by the Dread Lords. Only a few Iconians survived, hiding in a distant colony. Exceedingly cautious, and not without cause, Iconians have a strong sense of fatalism. But they have never given up hope of reclaiming their ancestral home, even if their cautious nature has prevented them from pursuing this dream.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ICONIAN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Iconians are overcautious and even paranoid as a result of living in hiding for generations. That said, living with limited resources has made them excellent farmers and repairers, and surprisingly accurate shots, their entire culture built around minimizing waste. And the harsh population controls they live under have only enhanced their understanding of fertility.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRATH_Dec
StringTable.String: Mysterious creatures who love to move in the shadows, the Drath are masters of subterfuge and manipulation. Rumored to be behind every major conflict in the galaxy, it is possible they spread some of those rumors themselves.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRATH_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: It's hard to say which of the stories about Embreyes Draken are true, only she knows.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRATH_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: Mysterious and manipulative, the Drath are marked by their unique and mysterious hatred for the Altarians. It turns out the Drath claim to have originated on and be the true owners of the planet Altar, though few who have heard the claim can see how that's possible. What is known is that they are clever and manipulative. Not aggressive by nature, and possessing a naturally slow growth rate, the Drath are not prone to wide expansion. But they make up for this with exceedingly, even suspiciously high diplomatic and economic skills.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRATH_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Drath have bonuses to diplomatic and economic skills but are hampered with a slow natural birth rate.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_IRIDIUM_Dec
StringTable.String: The Corporate Sector is ruled by a number of multi-planet corporations. With traders amongst the galaxy's best, the entire civilization's satisfaction and sense of self worth is unsurprisingly correlated with the amount of Credits in their coffers.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_IRIDIUM_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Invested in a warship, then made enough selling scrap from defeated pirates to pay for it many times over.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_IRIDIUM_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Corporate Sector is the apex corporate entity of an ultra capitalistic society, the only organization capable of entering into contracts on behalf of the entire Iridium people. The entire Iridium culture is based on a firm, even fanatical belief in the power of free markets. Although no strangers to weaponry, all research is first considered through the lens of mutual cooperation; the destructive cost of warfare is often too great for Iridiums to seriously consider. It remains to be seen how well this philosophy will fare when introduced to more close-minded races.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_IRIDIUM_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Corporate Sector is excellent at Research and Development and quick to maximize the economic potential of any new discovery. They have many ways to fill up the treasury, and they are well served to use them as their citizens are happiest when they are wealthy and dislike being poor.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ONYX_HIVE_Dec
StringTable.String: The Onyx Hive are a technologically sophisticated worm-like species that originated around the volcanic vents of their homeworld. With a society filled with backstabbing and intrigue, the Onyx make natural spies.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ONYX_HIVE_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: Owns a famous promethion vapor bar.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ONYX_HIVE_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Onyx Hive is a race of sentient worm-like beings, whose civilization developed around the volcanic vents of their home planet. Finding the surface of even their own homeworld intolerable, the Onyx are now almost entirely spacebased, doing most of their living in asteroids. Incredibly skilled at living in micro gravity environments, the Onyx are excellent asteroid miners. Additionally, most of their ship and starbase designs are influenced by or even incorporate the asteroids upon which they live.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ONYX_HIVE_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Onyx Hive are excellent at building spaceships, adapting a large number of their designs from the asteroids where they make their home.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_BARATAK_Dec
StringTable.String: Sentient tree-like creatures, the Baratak are strange to see in the harsh environment of space. But with an innate ability to revitalize dead worlds, their potential is considerable, and likely to follow different paths than their galactic peers.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_BARATAK_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: One of the first born upon her world, and she still remains.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_BARATAK_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
Denizens of a garden paradise, the Baratak followed a unique evolutionary path for a spacefaring civilization, being merely the most advanced of an array of symbiotic lifeforms in their homeworld's ecosystem.
Peaceful by nature, but incredibly intolerant of pollution - on both a moral and physical level - the Baratak have been greatly dismayed by the behavior they've witnessed in the other species of the galaxy, and aren't shy from expressing it. Also, don't ever ask them when their leaves will fall off.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_BARATAK_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Baratak excel at creating great planets. Their ability to transform a dead world to a living one allows them to create new colonies to feed into their core worlds and make even inhospitable solar systems bastions of life.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_RESISTANCE_Dec
StringTable.String: The Terran Resistance are the portion of humanity that wasn't trapped on Earth behind the Precursor Shield. Years on the run has made them resourceful but hard, and formed a schism with the rest of humanity which might take some time to heal.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_RESISTANCE_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: The oldest of seven children, and the only one that hasn't died in battle.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_RESISTANCE_StartupDescription
StringTable.String:
The Terran Resistance is the portion of the human race that was left to fend for itself when Earth was locked behind the Precursor Shield. For years they wandered the galaxy, avoiding the Drengin and their allies until they found a safe refuge near the far rim of the galaxy where they were able to rebuild, and even begin dreaming of a return to Earth.
The years of wandering has taught the Resistance a great deal, and they are now experts at ship recycling, asteroid mining, and operating covertly.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_RESISTANCE_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Terran Resistance are excellent at making do with limited resources and have become masters at ship recycling. Years of living on the run have also taught them valuable skills at remaining hidden and operating covertly.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DEFAULT_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: An alien species of unknown history and makeup. No-one knows who they are or where they came from, but it's a big galaxy - there was always going to be someone who fell through the cracks. They could be aggressive, civil, intelligent, foolish, large-nosed, or any combination of the above.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DEFAULT_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: This species has many qualities, some of them no doubt good or bad.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_PIRATES_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Pirate forces are decentralized and brutal. They do not have the resources of most races, so are slow to build forces, but in time can become a powerful threat if left unchecked.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_SENTINEL_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Pirate forces are decentralized and brutal. They do not have the resources of most races, so are slow to build forces, but in time can become a powerful threat if left unchecked.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_SPACEMONSTERS_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Pirate forces are decentralized and brutal. They do not have the resources of most races, so are slow to build forces, but in time can become a powerful threat if left unchecked.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DREADLORDS_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Pirate forces are decentralized and brutal. They do not have the resources of most races, so are slow to build forces, but in time can become a powerful threat if left unchecked.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_BURRAN_Dec
StringTable.String: A peaceful species who believes that a series of 7 "rigors" will cause them to be elevated to a godlike existence. Each rigor takes many years to accomplish and only the first 3 of these can be performed on their home planet, afterwards they explore the universe pursuing their tasks.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_BURRAN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: A peaceful species who believes that a series of 7 "rigors" will cause them to be elevated to a godlike existence. Each rigor takes many years to accomplish and only the first 3 of these can be performed on their home planet, afterwards they explore the universe pursuing their tasks.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_ORPHICA_Dec
StringTable.String: The Orphic Enclave serves only to expand the power of an ancient, renegade supercomputer.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_ORPHICA_LeaderDec
StringTable.String: The Orphic Prime unit is a computer of godlike computational capacity, assisted by harvested sentient brain matter.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_ORPHICA_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: Contrary to the general assumptions of uninformed galactic citizens, the Orphic Prime unit puppeteering the so-called "Orphic Enclave" is not a sentient artificial intelligence. An ancient experiment in genetic programming algorithms gone hellishly wrong, the long-extinct inhabitants of Orpheus have long since had their brain matter repurposed, expanding the Prime unit's computational power to Godlike proportions. Recently, the Orphic Prime unit has learned to exploit the galactic tourism industry: individuals are plugged in to perfect virtual reality while the idle portions of their mind add to the Prime unit's power.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_ORPHICA_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The more computational power the Orphic Prime unit has available, the more power it has over the landscape of Orpheus. Although its power grows slowly, over time, Orpheus can become a galactic powerhouse.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_KLEPART_Dec
StringTable.String: The first united technical achievement of their species was the creation of a great beacon tower to send their call out into space. A few days after turning it on an answer was received, a fleet of warships appeared in orbit above their world and raiders were sent down to collect every child on their homeworld. And then the raiders were gone. An entire generation of the Klepart was lost. The next generation has now grown old enough to begin exploring space on their own, but they remain fearful that the raiders will return, and hopeful that they will someday find the children that were stolen from them.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_KLEPART_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The first united technical achievement of their species was the creation of a great beacon tower to send their call out into space. A few days after turning it on an answer was received, a fleet of warships appeared in orbit above their world and raiders were sent down to collect every child on their homeworld. And then the raiders were gone. An entire generation of the Klepart was lost. The next generation has now grown old enough to begin exploring space on their own, but they remain fearful that the raiders will return, and hopeful that they will someday find the children that were stolen from them.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_KAXX_Dec
StringTable.String: They believe their home world is the cocoon for a sleeping creature and they were placed on the planet to guard her. One day they believe the creature will awake and either spread new life across the universe or kill everyone.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_KAXX_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: They believe their home world is the cocoon for a sleeping creature and they were placed on the planet to guard her. One day they believe the creature will awake and either spread new life across the universe or kill everyone.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_ODAIR_Dec
StringTable.String: Extreme nihilists counting down the moments until the universe succumbs to the eventual pull of entropy. Believe the Krynn in particular are the most foolish (for their faith) but are hard pressed to be enthused about anyone. There is a black hole at the edge of their galaxy, "The Yawning Mouth of God" that they delight in sending elaborate constructions into.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_ODAIR_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Extreme nihilists counting down the moments until the universe succumbs to the eventual pull of entropy. Believe the Krynn in particular are the most foolish (for their faith) but are hard pressed to be enthused about anyone. There is a black hole at the edge of their galaxy, "The Yawning Mouth of God" that they delight in sending elaborate constructions into.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_LANTERN_Dec
StringTable.String: A young but promising race until early galactic traders introduced them to euphoric vapors that were enjoyed by other species but deeply addictive to the Lantern. Now the Lantern society is dominated by the search for additional sources of the drug and all citizens are kept on it at all times.

StringTable.Label: MINOR_LANTERN_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: A young but promising race until early galactic traders introduced them to euphoric vapors that were enjoyed by other species but deeply addictive to the Lantern. Now the Lantern society is dominated by the search for additional sources of the drug and all citizens are kept on it at all times.
